intro: Louiseania triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed lily, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Iridaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of three-lobed, white or pale pink petals. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and wetland restoration projects.
